properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.access-token
properties.description: Pre-obtained access token for authentication. When provided, this token will be used directly instead of obtaining one through username/password or client credentials flow.

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.auth-client
properties.description: Filter admin events by authentication client ID

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.auth-ip-address
properties.description: Filter admin events by authentication IP address

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.auth-realm
properties.description: Keycloak realm to authenticate against. If not specified, the realm parameter is used for authentication. This is useful when you want to authenticate against one realm (e.g., master) but perform operations on another realm.

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.auth-realm-filter
properties.description: Filter admin events by authentication realm

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.auth-user
properties.description: Filter admin events by authentication user ID

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.bridge-error-handler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions (if possible) occurred while the Camel consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. Important: This is only possible if the 3rd party component allows Camel to be alerted if an exception was thrown. Some components handle this internally only, and therefore bridgeErrorHandler is not possible. In other situations we may improve the Camel component to hook into the 3rd party component and make this possible for future releases. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.client
properties.description: Filter events by client ID

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.client-id
properties.description: Keycloak client ID

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.client-secret
properties.description: Keycloak client secret

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.configuration
properties.description: Component configuration. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.keycloak.KeycloakConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.date-from
properties.description: Filter events by start date/time in milliseconds since epoch

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.date-to
properties.description: Filter events by end date/time in milliseconds since epoch

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the keycloak component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.event-type
properties.description: Type of events to consume: events or admin-events

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.first
properties.description: Offset for pagination (first result index)

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.introspection-cache-enabled
properties.description: Enable caching of token introspection results to reduce API calls to Keycloak

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.introspection-cache-ttl
properties.description: Time-to-live for cached introspection results in seconds

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.ip-address
properties.description: Filter events by IP address

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.keycloak-client
properties.description: To use an existing configured Keycloak admin client. The option is a org.keycloak.admin.client.Keycloak type.

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.max-results
properties.description: Maximum number of events to retrieve per poll

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.operation
properties.description: The operation to perform

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.operation-types
properties.description: Filter admin events by operation types (comma-separated list, e.g., CREATE,UPDATE,DELETE)

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.password
properties.description: Keycloak password

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.pojo-request
properties.description: If we want to use a POJO request as body or not

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.realm
properties.description: Keycloak realm, the default is master because usually all the operations are done starting from the master realm

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.resource-path
properties.description: Filter admin events by resource path

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.server-url
properties.description: Keycloak server URL

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.types
properties.description: Filter events by event types (comma-separated list, e.g., LOGIN,LOGOUT)

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.use-token-introspection
properties.description: Enable OAuth 2.0 token introspection for real-time token validation. When enabled, tokens are validated by calling Keycloak's introspection endpoint instead of local JWT parsing. This allows detecting revoked tokens before expiration.

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.user
properties.description: Filter events by user ID

properties.name: camel.component.keycloak.username
properties.description: Keycloak username
